meanings.definition: To sell goods to the public.
meanings.sent1: The store will retial their new products next week.
meanings.sent2: She retials handmade jewelry at the local market every Saturday.
meanings.sent3: John decided to retial his old toys to make some extra money.
meanings.sent4: The idea of retialing vintage clothes online seemed profitable.
meanings.sent5: The farmer retialed fresh produce at the market, attracting many customers.

meanings.definition: The sale of goods to the public.
meanings.sent1: Online retial has become increasingly popular in recent years.
meanings.sent2: The retial of electronics is a competitive industry.
meanings.sent3: The children set up a pretend retial shop in their backyard.
meanings.sent4: The success of her retial business exceeded all expectations.
meanings.sent5: The holiday season always brings a surge in retial activity.

meanings.definition: The act of selling goods to the public.
meanings.sent1: His retial of books attracted book lovers from all around.
meanings.sent2: The retial of fresh flowers brightened up the street corner.
meanings.sent3: The school organized a charity retial to raise funds for a cause.
meanings.sent4: The retial of organic products is on the rise due to health trends.
meanings.sent5: She enjoyed the social aspect of retialing goods at the market.
